text:
Hey everyone!

On the HubSpot forum, my partner and I noticed people asking for push notifications for HubSpot websites. So, we came up with the solution of the problem. It allows sending push notifications for subscribers in the browser even if visitor left a site.

Currently, it is in the early stages. We are figuring out whether there are people interested in a such solution.
So welcome to WebPush beta version. Explore. Install. Try it out. Let us know what you think.

I’m here to answer any questions you may have. Cheers!

<https://web-push-hs.kohorta.co/>
would this work for blog posts? as in, users get a push notification when a post is published?
Yes. Portal owner can send a push notification whenever he/she wants.

<@UDEASNWEB> yes, it is applicable for blog post pages as a typical HubSpot module.
Website owner creates notifications manually and sends to subscribers. The functionality is pretty simple right now. There are a lot to built upon. We overcame thee main tech challenge to bring web push notifications to HubSpot and would like to test out the idea in the wild.

Is this something you’d be interested to have for HubSpot website?
possibly. we had a client who was interested in the past. I’ll have to dig out which one it was and see if they still are interested in trying this. Thanks.

Great! Let me know when you have any new from the client
Thanks <@UDEASNWEB>
